info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:08PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in North Carolina... Broad River In NC At Boiling Springs affecting Cleveland County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River In NC at Boiling Springs. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Moderate Flooding continues. The Broad River is may be approaching several homes between Abe`s Mountain Rd and the river, including homes located along Waterway Dr. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.8 feet and rising rapidly. - Action/Advisory Stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below Moderate Flood Stage tomorrow morning then fall below Minor Flood Stage early tomorrow afternoon. The river will fall below Action/Advisory Stage Thursday morning. - Minor Flood Stage is 12.0 feet. Moderate Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued beforelate Wednesday night at 100 AM EST.
